.
When to Prepare a Proposed Rating Decision
Except as otherwise provided in
38 CFR 3.103(b)(3)
, an award of  compensation, pension, or Dependency and Indemnity Compensation cannot be reduced or otherwise adversely affected unless the beneficiary has been notified of the proposed adverse action and has been provided a period of 60 days in which to submit evidence showing that the adverse action should not be taken.  Refer to
38 CFR 3.103
and
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.A
and
B
for more information on the right to due process prior to a reduction in benefits.
Certain types of adverse actions require preparation of a proposed rating decision.  Situations requiring a proposed rating include, but are not limited to,
reduction of evaluation for compensation
reduction of pension, in certain circumstances
severance of service connection (SC)
termination of ancillary benefits
determinations of incompetency for payment purposes, or
reduction or termination of benefits that were erroneously awarded because of
an administrative error, or
error in judgment.
Exception
:  Do not prepare a proposed rating decision when the assigned effective date or evaluation will not reduce the total amount of compensation or pension payable.  For example, if a reduction in a Veteran’s service-connected knee evaluation would not reduce the overall combined evaluation, a proposed rating decision is not necessary.
References
:  For more information on
revision of decisions, see
38 CFR 3.105
reducing a benefit, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 4.B
severing SC, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.B
evaluating competency, see
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 6.A
clear and unmistakable errors that negatively affect the beneficiary, see
38 CFR 3.105(a)
, and
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 5.C.1.a
handling cases involving administrative error, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart i, 2.B.3
failure to report for routine future examinations, see
38 CFR 3.655(c)
, and
M21-1, Part IV, Subpart ii, 2.B
effective date of payment, see
38 CFR 3.31
, and
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart i, 1.A.2.b
, and
reducing a benefit without a proposed rating decision, see
VAOPGCPREC 71-1991
.
